text:
Hi, if I have a model like (from tutorial)

@model function coinFlip(Y)
	p ~ Beta(1, 1)
	for n in 1:length(Y)
		Y[n] ~ Bernoulli(p)
	end
end

and want to compute the posterior likelihood given p=0.5 with coinFlip([true, true, true, false]). Is there a way to do this within Turing?

Thank you!

One option is to use a kernel density estimate: <https://www.google.com/search?q=kerneldensity.jl&oq=&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8>

Another option might be a feature that Mohamad added to DynamicPPL. I didn't find any documentation, but here are some examples around 12:20 : <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aD_VEjDtOX0&t=1275s&ab_channel=TheJuliaProgrammingLanguage>
